childItems.name: HTML & CSS
childItems.notes: I am comfortable working across various standards including HTML5, HTML 4.01 Strict/Transitional, XHTML 1.0 Strict/Transitional, and CSS 2.1 & 3. Additionally, I am competent in testing and debugging cross-browser/platform issues and have experience in the sad and depressing world of HTML email marketing.

childItems.name: LESS
childItems.notes: While I have worked with client-side implementations of less.js, but my preferred method is to compile to CSS using a sublime plugin.

childItems.name: SASS
childItems.notes: I'm comfortable using a build automation tools like Grunt or Gulp, or an authoring framework like compass to work in the SCSS syntax.

childItems.name: ASP / PHP
childItems.notes: I have a limited amount of experience with sites built using ASP or PHP. I wouldn't be able write something from scratch, but I am comfortable tracking down root causes of client-side rendering issues

childItems.name: jQuery Mobile
childItems.notes: The majority of my experience has been in working with version 1.4+, but I do have limited experience with 1.3.1 & 1.3.2.

childItems.name: JavaScript
childItems.notes: While I generally prefer to use a library (jQuery/Underscore/etc) for more advance scripting, I routinely use vanilla JavaScript for low-level object/value manipulation in an effort to limit necessary overhead. I have a solid understanding of object-oriented and functional programming concepts, and am comfortable debugging nearly any JavaScript related issue.

childItems.name: jQuery
childItems.notes: I'm completely comfortable working with this library. I have experience implementing plugins, debugging version dependency & migration issues, and writing original functionality.

childItems.name: Underscore.js
childItems.notes: Underscore.js is a JavaScript library that provides functional programming helpers without extending any built-in objects. I've primarily used it as way to manipulate structured data in sites using a MVC-like design.

childItems.name: Lo-Dash
childItems.notes: Lo-Dash is a utility JavaScript library that was forked from underscore.js. It provides the functional programming helpers of underscore.js, while adding some additional feature and increasing performance.

childItems.name: Backbone.js
childItems.notes: While I don't have any example work, I am familiar with the general concepts and idiosyncrasies of this framework through the JavaScript course taught by The Starter League and Bocoup's Roost JavaScript Conference.

childItems.name: LightCMS
childItems.notes: LightCMS is a white label content management and e-commerce solution.
